briefdescription.para: kernel tensor is output channels, input channels, conv dimension (w x h)

detaileddescription.para: Get a human-readable description of the activation tensors. Activation tensors are stored in distributed matrices where each column corresponds to a mini-batch sample. Within each column, the data is packed w.r.t. the last tensor dimension, then w.r.t. the penultimate dimension, and so on. 3D tensors are assumed to be 2D images in NCHW format.

memberdef.argsstring: (lbann_comm *comm, int num_data_dims, int num_output_channels, int conv_dim, int pad, int stride, bool has_bias=true, cudnn::cudnn_manager *cudnn=nullptr)
memberdef.name: convolution_layer

memberdef.argsstring: (lbann_comm *comm, int num_data_dims, int num_output_channels, std::vector< int > conv_dims, std::vector< int > pads, std::vector< int > strides, bool has_bias=true, cudnn::cudnn_manager *cudnn=nullptr)
memberdef.name: convolution_layer

detaileddescription.para: Copy function. This function dynamically allocates memory for a layer instance and instantiates a copy. The caller is responsible for deallocating the instance.
Get the layer type's name. A layer type name should be brief, human-readable description of the layer's mathematical operation.

Get data layout of the data tensors. We assume that the data layouts of the previous activations, activations, previous error signals, and error signals are the same. Each concrete layer that is templated on its data layout should override this function to return its template parameter.
Setup tensor dimensions Called by the setup function. The base method sets the dimensions of the activation tensors equal to the dimensions of the first previous activation tensor.
Setup layer data. The kernel weights are setup in the convolution and deconvolution classes.
Perform the computation for the forward propagation step.
Perform the computation for the backward propagation step.
